result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason M. Foster is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason M. Foster was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.

After conclusion of hrg, it was determined that the deft has $1,000 posted.  Bond shall be applied towards fine/costs.  Balance may be returned to poster.  Clerk Lehman sent email to Atty Frank Parise

Minutes:  15CM1148/15CT11.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Frank Parise.  Cases are resolved.

15CM1148 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Deft fined $250 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 11 days work crew or 11 days KCJ.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

15CT11 - dismissed on State's motion.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Frank Parise.   Atty Frank Parise has now been retained.  FPT 1/7/16 @ 10:45am, JS 2/1/16 @ 9am along w/15CT11.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. The DE appeared in person without an attorney.  The state advises that the DE has new charges in 15CT11.  FPT rescheduled to 11/17/15 @ 9:30.  Clerk D. Smith.
To Cancel Warrant
